title: How to Put a Picture in a Locket

steps.title: Open the locket.
steps.content: Open the locket. Lay it flat with the open side facing you.

steps.title: Place a piece of tracing paper or regular paper over the photo recess.
steps.content: Place a piece of tracing paper or regular paper over the photo recess. The inside of the locket should have a slight recess meant to hold the photo in place. Lay a piece of tracing paper over the locket so you can see the recessed part through the paper. If you don't have tracing paper, you can use tissue paper or any thin paper you can see through. Some lockets have a recess on both sides, so it can hold two photos, while others just have it on one side.

steps.title: Use a pencil to trace around the recess.
steps.content: Use a pencil to trace around the recess. Lightly trace around the circular or ovular area where the photo will sit. Try not to crease the paper, since this will affect the size and shape of your tracing.

steps.title: Cut out the tissue paper template.
steps.content: Cut out the tissue paper template. Now you have a template the exact size your photo will need to be to fit neatly into the locket.

steps.title: Place the template over your chosen image.
steps.content: Place the template over your chosen image. Position it so that the face or image you want to store in your locket is contained within the borders of the template. Use a pencil to lightly trace around the template onto the photo.

steps.title: Cut out the photo to the same size as the template.
steps.content: Cut out the photo to the same size as the template. Use a scissors or a craft knife to neatly cut the photo to the exact size of your template.

steps.title: Glue the photo into the locket recess.
steps.content: Glue the photo into the locket recess. Place a dab of glue on the back of the photo. Gently insert it into the locket. Press it lightly to ensure it stays in place. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the glue dry before closing the locket.
steps.content: Allow the glue dry before closing the locket. Once dried, the locket is ready to wear.

steps.title: Take the locket with you to a copy center.
steps.content: Take the locket with you to a copy center. If you work in a place that has a copy machine, you're in luck. Otherwise take it to a store where you can make a copy using a machine. This method is best used for a locket that lies flat when it is open. If your locket's hinge won't allow it to lie flat, you won't be able to make a good copy. If you have a scanner and printer at home, that will work just as well.

steps.title: Open the locket and set it on the copy surface.
steps.content: Open the locket and set it on the copy surface. Make sure it is lying flat on the surface. The inside of the locket should be facing down.

steps.title: Make a copy.
steps.content: Make a copy. Be sure the copy machine settings are such that the copy is true to size (100 percent), rather than coming out smaller or larger than the actual locket. If you're using a scanner, scan the locket, open the image file on your computer, then print out the image. Make sure your scanner and printer settings allow you to print an image of the locket that's true to size (100 percent).

steps.title: Cut out the shape of the photo recess.
steps.content: Cut out the shape of the photo recess. You should be able to see a faint outline of the photo recess inside the locket. Use a scissors or craft knife to carefully cut it out. You'll use this template to cut your photo down to the right size.

steps.title: Place the template over your chosen image.
steps.content: Place the template over your chosen image. Position it so that the face or image you want to store in your locket is contained within the borders of the template. Use a pencil to lightly trace around the template onto the photo.

steps.title: Cut out the photo to the same size as the template.
steps.content: Cut out the photo to the same size as the template. Use a scissors or a craft knife to neatly cut the photo to the exact size of your template.

steps.title: Glue the photo into the locket recess.
steps.content: Glue the photo into the locket recess. Place a dab of glue on the back of the photo. Gently insert it into the locket. Press it lightly to ensure it stays in place. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Allow the glue dry before closing the locket.
steps.content: Allow the glue dry before closing the locket. Once dried, the locket is ready to wear.

steps.title: Obtain either an ink pad or simple craft paint.
steps.content: Obtain either an ink pad or simple craft paint. A water soluble, washable ink or paint is best, since you'll be stamping your locket directly into it. If using craft paint, to spread it very thinly on a paper plate. Don't use this method if your locket is very valuable. Since you'll be getting ink or paint directly on the locket, there's a possibility that it could get damaged. You may want to test the ink or paint in an inconspicuous spot, like the inside of the locket. Put a dab in the center of the locket and see if it easily wipes off with a damp cloth. If not, use another method.

steps.title: Open your locket and find the photo recess.
steps.content: Open your locket and find the photo recess. This is the side of the locket with a slightly raised border.

steps.title: Dip it into the ink or paint.
steps.content: Dip it into the ink or paint. Try not to get too much ink or paint on the locket; you only need enough to create a print of the photo recess.

steps.title: Stamp your locket on a piece of paper.
steps.content: Stamp your locket on a piece of paper. Place it carefully on the paper and lightly press down. When you lift the locket, an imprint of the inside edge should be on the paper. If this is not the case, repeat using more ink or paint.

steps.title: Immediately wipe the ink or paint off the locket.
steps.content: Immediately wipe the ink or paint off the locket. It is best to do this quickly, before the substance dries. Use a paper towel dipped in warm water to wipe it away, then dry it with a towel.

steps.content: Place the template over your chosen image. Position it so that the face or image you want to store in your locket is contained within the borders of the template. Use a pencil to lightly trace around the template onto the photo.

steps.content: Cut out the photo to the same size as the template. Use a scissors or a craft knife to neatly cut the photo to the exact size of your template.

steps.content: Glue the photo into the locket recess. Place a dab of glue on the back of the photo. Gently insert it into the locket. Press it lightly to ensure it stays in place.

steps.content: Allow the glue dry before closing the locket. Once dried, the locket is ready to wear.
